Unnamed Group of People.Sourced Statement: Fifty-two percent of 170 respondents said they need more information about what will happen to asylum.
Unnamed Group of People.Source Justification: readers of Documented, surveyed about their concerns regarding the upcoming election

Unnamed Group of People.Sourced Statement: An estimated 201,000 asylum seekers have passed through the city since 2022, many of whom were passengers on these Texas-funded buses.
Unnamed Group of People.Source Justification: individuals who have passed through NYC since 2022, many arriving via Texas-funded buses

Unnamed Group of People.Sourced Statement: An estimated 64,000 migrants still remain under NYC’s care.

Document Sources.Sourced Statement: As Documented covered in the past, this led to the expulsion of more than 2.8 million people.
Document Sources.Source Justification: previous reporting by Documented on the topic

Document Sources.Sourced Statement: Project 2025 is a plan created by a conservative think tank with ties to Trump that lays out what the president should change in the first 180 days after taking office.
Document Sources.Source Justification: plan created by a conservative think tank with ties to Trump

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “There is concern that they’ll [asylum restrictions] actually be implemented more effectively. Last time, he didn’t expect to win and didn’t have a professional class built around him that could actually get things done in government in general,”
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: political asylum lawyer and former government asylum officer
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: expertise in asylum law and experience as a government asylum officer

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “It is safe to assume that after the many missteps of his first presidency, that his administration would be better equipped to learn from their past mistakes and more effectively attack immigrant communities from the White House,”
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: Director of Immigrant Rights Policy, New York Immigration Coalition
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: leadership role in immigrant rights policy

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “The stuff about immigration is pretty severe. There are talks around the Project 2025 crowd about eliminating work authorization for asylum seekers, getting rid of TPS, Temporary Protected Status,”
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: political asylum lawyer and former government asylum officer
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: expertise in asylum law and experience as a government asylum officer

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “We anticipate the president, Trump, to use its executive authority to implement these policies — but again, we anticipate we should be able to challenge,”
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: Federal Policy Manager at African Communities Together (ACT)
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: expertise in federal policy and experience working with immigrant communities

Named Organization Sources.Sourced Statement: the government of Texas bussed migrants, crossing into the U.S. since the spring of 2022, to Democrat strongholds in Chicago and New York City.

“It is safe to assume that after the many missteps of his first presidency, that his administration would be better equipped to learn from their past mistakes and more effectively attack immigrant communities from the White House,”
Named Organization Sources.Source Justification: Marlene Galaz's leadership role and expertise in immigrant rights policy

Named Organization Sources.Sourced Statement: “We anticipate the president, Trump, to use its executive authority to implement these policies — but again, we anticipate we should be able to challenge,”
